page.title: 18Birds of Grafham Water.
page.content: Since the inception of the reservoir, wildlife conservation has been in the forefront of the minds of the planners. Consequently over the years increasing numbers of birds have been attracted to the area. A {hide }has been built and a shallow wader scape created. The largest number of {waterfowl} are to be seen between October and December. During the winter months rarer species such as Divers, Scoters, Scaup, Bewick's Swan and rarer Grebes may be seen. Away from the water, many species have been recorded by ornithologists who watch the area. These include migrants and winter visitors such as Wheatear, Stonechat, Whinchat and on rare occasions, Osprey, Hobby,Redstart and Ring Ouzel.
